quoteText: Dalio's right about gold surviving system failure. What most don't realize: you can actually hold physical gold in your IRA while keeping the tax advantages of your retirement account.
What he's not saying: while crypto holders panic-sell, physical precious metals can't be margin-called or liquidated by exchanges. Your 401(k) deserves that same protection.
What he's not saying: you can hold physical silver in your IRA just like your 401(k) holds stocks. Most people don't know this is even possible.
Silver's industrial demand keeps climbing while mining production stays flat. Meanwhile your 401k sits in digital assets that exist only on servers. Physical beats paper when the grid goes down.
He's being polite. The real question is why every financial advisor on TV is screaming 'buy the dip' while central banks quietly stack gold like it's 1971 all over again.
He's being polite. The people who spent decades calling precious metals "barbarous relics" while printing trillions will suddenly discover they need what you've got.
Ron Paul's been saying this for decades while every financial advisor kept telling people to trust the system. Guess who's looking smarter now that the cracks are showing.
He's being nice about it. The real question is why Bitcoin held up while actual money got hammered. Almost like someone wanted you to think digital air is safer than 5000 years of monetary history.
He's being polite. The real question is why every central bank on earth is buying gold while your 401k provider won't even let you touch it. Almost like they know something you don't.
He's being polite. The real question is why every central bank on earth is buying gold hand over fist while your 401k provider still pretends it doesn't exist as an asset class.
